Description:
SummaryThe Environmental Engineer will provide specialized expertise in ensuring that the ENOWA power generation projects, which encompasses solar, wind, geothermal, thermal (grid-connected), and off-grid power generation, are compliant with environmental regulations and sustainable practices. Their role is pivotal in minimizing the environmental footprint throughout the design, construction, and operational phases of the project.Key Accountabilities and ResponsibilitiesEngineering Management       Conduct/support EIAs to identify potential environmental impacts and propose mitigation measures.
Coordinate with interdisciplinary teams to integrate environmental considerations into project planning.
Ensure all project activities adhere to local, national, and international environmental regulations.
Obtain necessary environmental permits and licenses and ensure ongoing compliance.
Collaborate with design teams to infuse sustainability and eco-friendly technologies into project designs.
Review project plans and designs to ensure they align with environmental best practices.
Monitor environmental parameters during construction and operation to ensure compliance with environmental standards.
Prepare regular environmental performance reports for internal review and regulatory submissions.
Develop and oversee waste management plans, emphasizing recycling and minimizing waste.
Monitor waste disposal methods to ensure they meet environmental standards.
Collaborate in the development of emergency response plans concerning environmental incidents.
Coordinate responses to any environmental incidents or concerns, ensuring swift mitigation and thorough documentation.
Interface with regulatory bodies and stakeholders to address environmental concerns and gather feedback.
Act as the project's environmental representative in stakeholder engagements.
Provide regular environmental performance updates to senior management and other relevant parties.Background, SkillsIn-depth understanding of environmental management aspects related to thermal and renewable power generation technologies.
Proven experience in overseeing large-scale power generation projects from design to operation from an environmental perspective.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
A track record of successful collaboration with multidisciplinary teams.
Knowledge of local, national, and international environmental standards and regulations in power generation.
Outstanding problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify, analyze, and resolve technical challenges.
Highly effective communication skills to liaise with internal teams, external partners, and regulatory authorities.
Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Strong leadership skills and ability to work independently and in a team.
Travels to project sites as needed.QualificationsBachelor's degree in Environmental Engineering or related field; a Masterâ€™s degree or further specialized training would be advantageous.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in environmental engineering within the power generation sector, with exposure to both thermal and renewable technologies.
Professional certifications related to environmental management would be beneficial.
Professional certifications (e.g., PMP, PE, CEng) or equivalent.Job Details
